description: The Romans frequently incorporated colorful gemstones into their jewelry. This delicately woven gold chain features a single emerald pendant. At the back, a gold wire rosette fastening is decorated with a central garnet stud. Ornamental fastenings such as this were a Roman innovation, and they required a fashionable, upswept hairstyle—a clear sign of the wearer’s social standing—in order to be fully appreciated.
title: Necklace with Pendant
